The values can easily get in the way of what's actually intended. backfire 事与愿违 side effect 副作用 get in the way of 妨碍 get in xx's way On a anagement training course I once attended, once 曾经 The other teams tried to collaborate on building the structure, and descended into confusion , with everyone getting in each other's way . descend into confusion 陷入混乱 get in xx's way 妨碍 brilliantly ['briljəntli] 辉煌地 comply with the rule comply [kəm'plaɪ] 遵守，顺从 let // the person in the team with an aptitude for puzzles like this// build it alone. 注意断句let the person build it alone. with an aptitude for puzzles 有解谜题的天赋 In the case of a smartphone that a certain company launched, one director wanted to target the business market , and another demanded it was aimed at consumers. target 把目标放在 business market 企业市场 demand 要求 have his way 得逞 industriousness industrious [ɪn'dʌstrɪəs] 勤奋的 It's easy to mock people who say they work hard: after all , a hamster running around in a wheel is working hard - and getting nowhere. mock [mɒk] 嘲笑 after all 毕竟 hamster 仓鼠 wheel [wiːl] 车轮 the resources that companies value most. value vt. 重视 Here 'lazy' means having a rational determination not to carry out unnecessary tasks. rational ['ræʃ(ə)n(ə)l] 合理的 carry out 执行 这里的unnecessary 会听不怎么清un- they possess intellectual clarity , and they don't rush into making decisions. possess [pə'zes] 持有 clarity ['klærɪtɪ] 清晰 rush into 匆忙做。hurry up and [do sth] come up with 想出，提出 creat an attention-grabbing TV commercial . attention-grabbing 引人注目的。grab 抓走 commercial [kə'mɜːʃ(ə)l] 商业广告。adj.商业的，盈利的 plenty of 大量的 subsequent ['sʌbsɪkw(ə)nt] 随后的 derives pleasure from .. [dɪ'raɪv] 从xx得到快乐 profit ['prɒfɪt] 利润，利益 to solve a problem that the company has identified. 解决公司已经确认的问题 claim they "strive for excellence" 声称他们为卓越而奋斗 pioneer 先锋，拓荒者 market share 市场占有率 reading-1 ¶ Cork - the thick bark of the cork oal tree (Quercus suber) - is a remarkable material. Cork 软木。出现学名不懂也没办法 thick [θɪk] 厚的 bark [bɑːk] 树皮，毛皮 cork oal tree 软木橡树 remarkable [rɪ'mɑːkəb(ə)l] 卓越的，值得注意的。remark(评论) mark(标记) It is tough , elastic , buoyant , and fire-resistant , and suitable for a wide range of purposes. tough [tʌf] 坚韧的 elastic [ɪ'læstɪk] adj.有弹性的 n.橡皮圈 buoyant [ˈbɔɪənt] 轻快的 fire-resistant ['faɪə] [rɪ'zɪstənt] 抗火的 It has also been used for millennia : the ancient Egyptians sealed their sarcophagy (stone coffins ) with cork, while the ancient Greeks and Romans used it for anything from beehives to sandals . millennia [mɪˈleniə] 一千年 Egyptians [i:'dʒipʃənz] 埃及人 Greeks 希腊人 Romans 罗马人 seal [siːld] 封闭 coffins 棺材 beehive ['biːhaɪv] 蜂房 sandals ['sændlz] 凉鞋 And the cork oak itself is an extraordinary tree. extraordinary [ɪkˈstrɔːdənrɪ] 非凡的 Its bark grows up to 20 cm in thickness, insulating the tree like a coat wrapped around the trunk and branches and keeping the inside at a constant 20 ℃ all year round. insulate ['ɪnsjʊleɪt] 使绝缘 illustrate(说明) trunk 树干 Developed most probably as a defence against forest fires, the bar of the cork oak has a particular cellular structure - with about 40 million cells per cubic centimetre - that technology has never succeeded in replicating . 过去分词引导的句子做状语 most probably 很可能地 forest 森林 bar 棒，障碍 cellular 细胞的 centimetre ['sentɪmiːtə] 公分，厘米 (下下句里)millimetre ['mili,mi:tə] 毫米 replicate 复制 It also has an elasticity that means you can squash it and watch it spring back to its original size and shape when you release the pressure. squash 挤压 spring back 生长(spring有跳起、裂开的意思n/vi.vt) They flourish in warm, sunny climates where there is a minimum of 400 millimetres of rain per year. flourish ['flʌrɪʃ] 兴旺 climate [ˈklaɪmɪt] 气候 a minimum of 400 millimetres of rain Like grape vines , the trees thrive in poor soil , putting down deep roots in search of moisture and nutrients . grape vine 葡萄 藤 thrive [θraɪv] 兴旺，茁壮成长 (flourish) soil 土壤 moisture ['mɒɪstʃə] 水分 nutrient ['njuːtrɪənt] n.营养物，adj.营养的。nutritious有营养的，nutrition营养，营养学 in search of Today accounts for roughly half of all cork production around the world. ... are around 200 years old accounts for xx of xx 占比 around adv.大约，到处，在附近，prep.在周围 an exercise in patience 对耐心的锻炼 From the planting of a cork sapling to the first harvest takes 25 years, and a gap of approximately a decade must separate harvests from an individual tree. sapling ['sæplɪŋ] 树苗 harvest ['hɑːvɪst] 收获 separate (使)分开 If the bark is stripped on a day when it's too cold - or when the air is damp - the tree will be damaged. strip 脱去 damp 潮湿的 Cork harvesting is a very specialised profession . No mechanical means of stripping cork bark has been invented. specialised profession 特别的职业 mechanical means 机械手段 invent 发明 They make vertical cuts down the bark using small sharp axes , then lever it away in pieces as large as they can manage. vertical 垂直的 sharp axes 尖锐的斧头 lever 杠杆撬动 The most skilful cork-strippers prise away a semi-circular husk that runs the lenght of the trunk from just above ground level to the first branches. It is then dried on the ground. prise 撬动 (lever) semi-circular 半圆形的 husk [hʌsk] 皮，外壳 (bark) ground 地面 dry 使变干 It is boiled to kill any insects that might remain in the cork. boil 煮沸 insect ['ɪnsekt] 昆虫 Over 60% of cork then goes on to be made into traditional bottle stoppers , with most of the remainder being used in the construction trade. go on 继续 bottle stoppers 瓶塞 construction 建设 Corkboard and cork tiles are ideal for thermal and acoustic insulation, while granules of cork are used in the manufacture of concrete. tile 瓷砖 ideal 理想的 thermal ['θɜːm(ə)l] 热量的 acoustic [ə'kuːstɪk] 声学的 granules [grænju:ls] 颗粒 manufacture [mænjʊ'fæktʃə] 加工，制造 Recent years have seen the end of the virtual monopoly of cork as the material for bottle stoppers, due to concerns about the effect it may have on the contents of the bottle. docs.text: Cork - the thick bark of the cork oal tree (Quercus suber) - is a remarkable material. Cork 软木。出现学名不懂也没办法 thick [θɪk] 厚的 bark [bɑːk] 树皮，毛皮 cork oal tree 软木橡树 remarkable [rɪ'mɑːkəb(ə)l] 卓越的，值得注意的。remark(评论) mark(标记) It is tough , elastic , buoyant , and fire-resistant , and suitable for a wide range of purposes. tough [tʌf] 坚韧的 elastic [ɪ'læstɪk] adj.有弹性的 n.橡皮圈 buoyant [ˈbɔɪənt] 轻快的 fire-resistant ['faɪə] [rɪ'zɪstənt] 抗火的 It has also been used for millennia : the ancient Egyptians sealed their sarcophagy (stone coffins ) with cork, while the ancient Greeks and Romans used it for anything from beehives to sandals . millennia [mɪˈleniə] 一千年 Egyptians [i:'dʒipʃənz] 埃及人 Greeks 希腊人 Romans 罗马人 seal [siːld] 封闭 coffins 棺材 beehive ['biːhaɪv] 蜂房 sandals ['sændlz] 凉鞋 And the cork oak itself is an extraordinary tree. extraordinary [ɪkˈstrɔːdənrɪ] 非凡的 Its bark grows up to 20 cm in thickness, insulating the tree like a coat wrapped around the trunk and branches and keeping the inside at a constant 20 ℃ all year round. insulate ['ɪnsjʊleɪt] 使绝缘 illustrate(说明) trunk 树干 Developed most probably as a defence against forest fires, the bar of the cork oak has a particular cellular structure - with about 40 million cells per cubic centimetre - that technology has never succeeded in replicating . 过去分词引导的句子做状语 most probably 很可能地 forest 森林 bar 棒，障碍 cellular 细胞的 centimetre ['sentɪmiːtə] 公分，厘米 (下下句里)millimetre ['mili,mi:tə] 毫米 replicate 复制 It also has an elasticity that means you can squash it and watch it spring back to its original size and shape when you release the pressure. squash 挤压 spring back 生长(spring有跳起、裂开的意思n/vi.vt) They flourish in warm, sunny climates where there is a minimum of 400 millimetres of rain per year. flourish ['flʌrɪʃ] 兴旺 climate [ˈklaɪmɪt] 气候 a minimum of 400 millimetres of rain Like grape vines , the trees thrive in poor soil , putting down deep roots in search of moisture and nutrients . grape vine 葡萄 藤 thrive [θraɪv] 兴旺，茁壮成长 (flourish) soil 土壤 moisture ['mɒɪstʃə] 水分 nutrient ['njuːtrɪənt] n.营养物，adj.营养的。nutritious有营养的，nutrition营养，营养学 in search of Today accounts for roughly half of all cork production around the world. ... are around 200 years old accounts for xx of xx 占比 around adv.大约，到处，在附近，prep.在周围 an exercise in patience 对耐心的锻炼 From the planting of a cork sapling to the first harvest takes 25 years, and a gap of approximately a decade must separate harvests from an individual tree. sapling ['sæplɪŋ] 树苗 harvest ['hɑːvɪst] 收获 separate (使)分开 If the bark is stripped on a day when it's too cold - or when the air is damp - the tree will be damaged. strip 脱去 damp 潮湿的 Cork harvesting is a very specialised profession . No mechanical means of stripping cork bark has been invented. specialised profession 特别的职业 mechanical means 机械手段 invent 发明 They make vertical cuts down the bark using small sharp axes , then lever it away in pieces as large as they can manage. vertical 垂直的 sharp axes 尖锐的斧头 lever 杠杆撬动 The most skilful cork-strippers prise away a semi-circular husk that runs the lenght of the trunk from just above ground level to the first branches. It is then dried on the ground. prise 撬动 (lever) semi-circular 半圆形的 husk [hʌsk] 皮，外壳 (bark) ground 地面 dry 使变干 It is boiled to kill any insects that might remain in the cork. boil 煮沸 insect ['ɪnsekt] 昆虫 Over 60% of cork then goes on to be made into traditional bottle stoppers , with most of the remainder being used in the construction trade. go on 继续 bottle stoppers 瓶塞 construction 建设 Corkboard and cork tiles are ideal for thermal and acoustic insulation, while granules of cork are used in the manufacture of concrete. tile 瓷砖 ideal 理想的 thermal ['θɜːm(ə)l] 热量的 acoustic [ə'kuːstɪk] 声学的 granules [grænju:ls] 颗粒 manufacture [mænjʊ'fæktʃə] 加工，制造 Recent years have seen the end of the virtual monopoly of cork as the material for bottle stoppers, due to concerns about the effect it may have on the contents of the bottle. This is caused by a chemical compound call 2,4,6-trichloroanisole (TCA), which forms through the interaction of plant phenols, chlorine and mould. virtual [ˈvɜ:tʃuəl] 虚拟的，实质上的（但未正式被承认） monopoly [mə'nɒp(ə)lɪ] 垄断 chemical compound ['kemɪk(ə)l]['kɒmpaʊnd] 化合物 interaction 互动 phenols, chlorine 酚，氯 mould 霉 The tiniest concentrations - as little as three or four parts to a trillion - can spoil the taste of the product contained in the botltle. tiniest 最 微小的(tiny) concentration 关注点 spoil 糟蹋，破坏，溺爱 The result has been a gradual yet steady move first towards plastic stoppers and, more recently, to aluminium screw caps. These substitutes are cheaper. gradual 逐渐的, graduate 毕业(的) yet 还，但是 steady 稳定 stable plastic 塑料(的) aluminium 铝的 screw n.螺旋，v.拧 cap 帽，盖 substitute 替代品 alternative n.替代的选择adj.交替的选择性的 alternation n.交替 classic 经典的 同classical，前者还有著作，后者有古典音乐之意 *Its traditional image is more in keeping with that of the type of high quality goods with which it has long been associated. traditional image 传统形象 in keeping with 符合 sustainable 可持续发展的 sustain 维持 biodiversity [,baɪə(ʊ)daɪ'vɜːsɪtɪ] 生物多样性 desertification 沙漠化 The future of this ancient material once again looks promising . promising 有希望的 长难句 The result has been a gradual yet steady move first towards plastic stoppers and, more recently, to aluminium screw caps. 这就导致了塑料瓶塞逐渐得到了应用，而最近，铝制螺旋盖也得到了应用。 Firstly, its traditional image is more in keeping with that of the type of high quality goods with which it has long been associated. 首先，它的传统形象和长期以来与之想联系的高品质产品更加匹配。

docs.text: Collecting must be one of the most varied of human activities, and it's one that many of us psychologists find fascinating . the most varied (the 最高级)作名词性短语 psychologist [sai'kɔledʒist] 心理学家 fascinating ['fæsɪneɪtɪŋ] 迷人的 Many forms of collecting have been dignified with a technical name: an archtophilist collects teddy bears, a philatelist collects postage stamps, and a deltiologist collects postcards. dignify ['dɪgnɪfaɪ] 使高贵 amass [ə'mæs] 积累，accumulate this could be called an instrumental reason for collecting. instrumental 乐器的，器械的。但在这里表示 有帮助的 as a mean to an end 作为达到目的的手段 They'll look for antiques that they can buy cheaply and expect to be able to sell at a profit . antique [æn'tiːk] 古董 unique 唯一的 profit ['prɒfɪt] 利润，利益 buying cheap and selling dear cheap 和 cheaply都可作adv dear 在这里作昂贵的意思 give the collector a sense of triumph . triumph ['traɪʌmf] v.n. （取得）巨大胜利 This is a variant on joining a bridge club or a gym , and similarly brings them into contact with like-minded people. variant ['veərɪənt] 变体 gym 健身房，体育馆 like-minded 志趣相投的 spend their whole lives in a hunt for this. hunt [hʌnt] 寻找 Without those collections, our understanding would be greatly inferior to what it is. greatly inferior 相当地初级 to a lesser extent 在较小程度上。 to a certain extent在一定程度上 trainspotting 收集机车号码 locomotive [ləʊkə'məʊtɪv] 火车头 tick off 列举，标出 work out 得到，算出 As a byproduct , many practitioners of the hobby become very knowledgeable about railway operations, or the technical specifications of different engine types. byproduct 副产品 practitioner [præk'tɪʃ(ə)nə] 实践者 knowledgeable 有见识的 specification 规格 dolls 玩偶， 别看成dollar..
